sentence: The House was out of session for over 50 days because Speaker Johnson  refused to bring Congress back to resolve the healthcare crisis created  by Republicans and to reopen the government.
The style of it is: What are the  elements of the Republican healthcare crisis?
Speaker Johnson and House Republicans are pushing this bill on  the floor to address a political crisis, not the healthcare crisis.

Well, what is really happening out there is that we are in a  healthcare crisis, and that is because the big beautiful betrayal of a  bill will kick 15 million Americans off their healthcare, force  hospitals, health clinics, and nursing homes to close.

Speaker, I wish we were here on the House floor this morning  debating solutions that would reduce grocery bills, lower housing  costs, end Trump's tariffs that are strangling American small  businesses and manufacturers, solve the Republican healthcare crisis,  or any legislation that allows Americans to afford to live through the  catastrophic economic policies of Trump and the Republicans.

Meanwhile,  grocery prices are surging, and, of course, monthly healthcare premiums  are skyrocketing across the Nation, thanks to the healthcare crisis  Republicans created by failing to extend the Affordable Care Act's  enhanced premium tax credits.
Speaker, we have reached the precipice of a full-blown  healthcare crisis in North Carolina and this country.
This Republican bill does not fix the healthcare crisis facing this  country.
We are facing a  serious and worsening maternal healthcare crisis.
Speaker, every day, more Americans are being hurt by  the Republican healthcare crisis.
We know that there is a healthcare crisis looming in this country.

It was one of the solutions to this maternal  healthcare crisis that expert after expert after expert says: Just make  sure those women who gave birth are not knocked off of healthcare after  2 months.
States across the country have created a full-blown  healthcare crisis in the chaos and confusion that has ensued.
We should be united in addressing  the Republicans' looming healthcare crisis and the rising cost of  living.
President, I also want to rise to talk about the serious  healthcare crisis and the affordability crisis that is affecting our  Nation.
To call this, and I have heard it said a couple of times already, a  Republican healthcare crisis is fake news.
Speaker, when you hear Members on the  other side say that the Republicans created this healthcare crisis.

Ignoring this reality,  Democrats came back for more during the COVID pandemic, using a  national healthcare crisis as an opportunity to serve up more of the  same bad recipe for our healthcare needs.
Their failure to address the  healthcare crisis and extend tax credits for health insurance premiums  has increased the cost of healthcare for Americans.
Republicans' legislation created a $50 billion Rural  Health Transformation Program to address the rural healthcare crisis.
If we want to look at where this all began, as some on the other  side, Democrats, want to talk about a healthcare crisis, the healthcare  law of the land is what many refer to as ObamaCare.
